articles.title: Congratulatory Messages to Kim Jong Il
Celebration Meetings in Different Countries
articles.content:
Congratulatory Messages to Kim Jong Il 
    Pyongyang, February 17 (KCNA) -- Leader Kim Jong Il received congratulatory messages from the Standing Council of the Federation of Korean Traders and Industrialists in Japan, the Central Standing Committees of the Korean Youth League in Japan and the Union of Democratic Korean Women in Japan and other bodies and organizations under the General Association of Korean Residents in Japan (Chongryon), the Choson Sinbo , the Korean  News Service, the Haku Sobang Publishing House, the Kumgangsan Opera Troupe and other business bodies, each local headquarters of Chongryon, Joson University, Korean schools of all levels in Japan and compatriots on the occasion of his birthday.
 The messages heartily extended the highest glory and warmest congratulations to Kim Jong Il, the sun of the 21st century and benevolent father of the nation, representing the infinite reverence and loyalty of Chongryon officials and Koreans in Japan for him on the occasion of the auspicious greatest national holiday of February.
 The Chongryon officials and Koreans in Japan, filled with the great national pride of holding the great brilliant commander of Songun in esteem, will steadily take a patriotic road, keeping step with the people in the homeland who are making a comprehensive offensive toward the high peak of building a great prosperous powerful socialist nation full of great ambition and confidence under the leadership of Kim Jong Il this year significantly marking the 80th founding anniversary of the Down-with-Imperialism Union, the messages said, stressing: 
 Chongryon officials and Koreans in Japan will thoroughly implement the June 15 joint declaration, holding high the slogans "Let us vigorously forward the patriotic movement for independent reunification, peace against war and great national unity under the banner of 'by our nation itself!'" and thus make positive contributions to opening a new phase in the cause of national reunification.

articles.title: Foreign Figures Visit DPRK Embassies
articles.content:
Celebration Meetings in Different Countries 
    Pyongyang, February 17 (KCNA) -- Meetings were held in Warsaw of Poland, Ostfold of Norway and Lahore of Pakistan from Feb. 2 to 7 to celebrate the holiday of February.
 Speeches were made at the meetings.    
 Juzef Lachut, vice-chairman of the National Executive Committee of the Polish Communist Party, highly praised leader Kim Jong Il for firmly defending socialism, peace and regional stability with his extraordinary courage and strategy.
 His outstanding Songun politics serves as a firm guarantee for the Korean people to put an end to all sorts of interference of the foreign forces and achieve the peaceful reunification of the country in the idea of "By our nation itself", said the vice-chairman.
 Dag Norum, chairman of the Ostfold County Committee of the Communist Party of Norway, noted that Kim Jong Il has wisely led the whole party, the whole army and all the people to build a great prosperous powerful socialist nation under the banner of socialism by successfully carrying forward the revolutionary cause of President Kim Il Sung.
 C. R. Aslam, president of the Pakistan Socialist Party, expressed the belief that the Korean people would decisively smash the U.S. imperialists' moves to isolate and stifle them and achieve the reunification of the country in an independent and peaceful way under the wise leadership of Kim Jong Il.    
 Congratulatory messages to Kim Jong Il were adopted at the meetings held in Norway and Pakistan.

articles.title: Foreigners Release Statements on Holiday of February
articles.content:
Foreign Figures Visit DPRK Embassies 
    Pyongyang, February 17 (KCNA) -- Leaders and representatives of the Workers' Party, the Socialist Party, the Communist Party (Marxist�|Leninist), the National Socialist Party and other political parties under the Left Democratic Front of Bangladesh, the Malaysian vice-minister of Youth and Sports, the chairman of the Standing Committee of Science and Technology of the National Assembly of Thailand, members of the Syrian People's Assembly who are delegates of the Syria-Korea Friendship Parliamentary Group and the vice-chairman and international secretary of the Central Committee of the Brazilian Communist Party paid congratulatory visits to the relevant DPRK embassies from Feb. 7 to 13 on the occasion of the birthday of leader Kim Jong Il.
 Representatives of foreign political parties and organizations and public figures laid floral baskets and bouquets before the portraits or statues of President Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il and made bows.    
 They highly praised the exploits of Kim Jong Il who is making immortal contributions to the Korean revolution and the human cause of independence under the banner of Songun and sincerely wished him good health and great success in his work.

articles.title: Song and Dance Performance Celebrates February 16
Kim Yong Nam Meets Art Troupe of Koreans in Japan
articles.content:
Song and Dance Performance Celebrates February 16 
    Pyongyang, February 17 (KCNA) -- The Song and Dance Ensemble of the Korean People's Army gave a performance celebrating February 16 at the Servicemen's Hall of the Ministry of the People's Armed Forces on Thursday.
 Put on the stage were songs and dances representing the unbounded reverence and best wishes of the KPA and the people for Kim Jong Il including instrumental music and song "We Present Flowers to You" and "Native Home Covered with White Snow."
 The performers depicted with deep emotion the deep trust of the KPA and the people in Kim Jong Il in such numbers as female folk solo "When We Advance after Him," comic story "Arirang for Prosperity" and dance "Spring in Secret Camp."
 The performance ended with instrumental music and song "Let's Support Our Supreme Commander with Arms," which powerfully demonstrated the iron-willed faith and will of the KPA and the people.    
 Among the audience were Jo Myong Rok, director of the General Political Department of the KPA, Kim Yong Chun, chief of the General Staff of the KPA, Kim Il Chol, minister of the People's Armed Forces, leading officials of the Ministry of the People's Armed Forces and KPA servicepersons.

articles.title: Joint National Meeting of KCU Organizations
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam Meets Art Troupe of Koreans in Japan 
    Pyongyang, February 17 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, met and had a talk in a compatriotic atmosphere with the art troupe of Koreans in Japan for celebrating Feb. 16 led by Kim Kyong Hwa, deputy head of the Kumgangsan Opera Troupe of the General Association of Korean Residents in Japan (Chongryon) on Thursday.
 On hand were Kim Ki Nam, secretary of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea, Ro Tu Chol, vice-premier of the Cabinet, and Nam Sung U, vice-chairman of the Central Standing Committee of Chongryon who is heading the congratulatory group of Koreans in Japan on a visit to the socialist homeland.

articles.title: Greetings to Lithuanian President
First Camping at Jangjasan Children's Union Camp
articles.content:
Greetings to Lithuanian President 
    Pyongyang, February 17 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, Thursday sent a message of greetings to Lithuanian President Valdas Adamkus on the occasion of the national day of Lithuania.
Kim expressed the belief that the friendly and cooperative relations between the DPRK and Lithuania would favorably develop in mutual interests.

articles.title: Art Troupe of Koreans in Japan Gives Guest Performance
Celebration Concert Held
Reception for Overseas Compatriots
Overseas Koreans Give Guest Performance to Celebrate Feb. 16
articles.content:
Reception for Overseas Compatriots
    Pyongyang, February 17 (KCNA) -- A reception was given in honor of overseas compatriots at the People's Palace of Culture on Thursday on the occasion of leader Kim Jong Il's birthday. 
 Present on invitation were overseas compatriots including members of the congratulatory group of Koreans in Japan, the congratulatory group of the General Association of Koreans in China, the congratulatory group of the Federation of Koreans in the U.S., the congratulatory group of the Federation of Koreans in Canada, the congratulatory group of the Society for Cooperation among Koreans in Germany, the congratulatory group of the Federation of Koreans in Australia, the delegation of officials of the General Association of Korean Residents in Japan (Chongryon), the delegation of women officials of the new generation of Chongryon and the art troupes of Koreans in Japan, China and the U. S. celebrating February 16.  
 Kim Jung Rin, secretary of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea, in a speech expressed the conviction that overseas compatriots will make a tangible  contribution to the building of a great prosperous powerful socialist nation true to the Songun leadership of Kim Jong Il, bearing deep in mind the great pride in holding him in high esteem as the father of the nation, conduct the three-point patriotic movement for independent reunification, peace against war and great national unity under the banner of the June 15 North-South joint declaration and positively contribute to the implementation of the cause of national reunification.    
 Nam Sung U, vice-chairman of the Central Standing Committee of Chongryon who is heading the congratulatory group of Koreans in Japan, in a speech said that thanks to the special loving care of Kim Jong Il for the overseas compatriots they could imposingly glorify the proud annuals of patriotism even in an alien land.    
 He also emphasized that they would make a tangible contribution to national reunification and the building of a great prosperous powerful nation, keeping step with the people in the homeland who are putting spurs to the general march of the Songun revolution with great ambition and confidence to make a higher and quicker leap. 
 Artistes gave a performance at the reception.

articles.title: Russian Military Band Leaves
articles.content:
Overseas Koreans Give Guest Performance to Celebrate Feb. 16
    Pyongyang, February 17 (KCNA) -- The art troupes of Koreans in China and the U.S. and a Korean artiste in Canada gave a performance for guests of honor at the Yun I Sang Concert Hall on Thursday in celebration of Feb. 16.
 The performance was appreciated by Choe Thae Bok, Choe Yong Rim and Ryu Mi Yong, chairperson of the C.C., the Korean Chondoist Chongu Party, and officials concerned and citizens.    
 Among the audience were the congratulatory groups of the General Association of Koreans in China, the Federation of Koreans in the U.S., the Federation of Koreans in Canada and other overseas Koreans.    
 The performance began with piano concerto "Snowstorm of Mt. Paektu".
 Put on the stage were colorful numbers including orchestra "The General of Korea", male solo "Fascination", mixed duet "Song of Holiday", cello concerto "Best Wishes", male solo "Ye Scops Owl" and mixed duet "We Had a Picture Taken".
 The performers successfully represented with their artistic talents the faith and will of the Korean people at home and overseas to hold leader Kim Jong Il, the destiny of the Korean nation and lodestar of national reunification, forever in high esteem and achieve the eternal prosperity of Juche Korea.

articles.title: Greetings to Gambian President
articles.content:
Russian Military Band Leaves
    Pyongyang, February 17 (KCNA) -- The central military band of the Defence Ministry of Russia wound up its 11-day visit to the DPRK and went back home today.
 During its stay the military band visited Mangyongdae and laid bouquets at the Revolutionary Martyr's Cemetery on Mt. Taesong and the Liberation Tower. 
 It also visited the venue of the 10th Kimjongilia Festival, the Tower of the Juche Idea and the Victorious Fatherland Liberation War Museum and other places.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il Enjoys Performance Given by State Symphony Orchestra
articles.content:
Greetings to Gambian President
    Pyongyang, February 17 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, Monday sent a message of greetings to Gambian President Yaya A. J. J. Jammeh on the occasion of the 41st anniversary of the independence of Gambia. 
 Expressing the belief that the friendly relations between the two countries would favorably develop in the future,too, the message wished the president greater success in his responsible work for the stability and development of the country.
